commit_message:
Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL

As discussed in the Liberty Design Summit "Moving apps to Python 3"
cross-project workshop, the way forward in the near future is to
switch to the pure-python PyMySQL library as a default.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-cross-project-python3

Change-Id: I5aa90236424818e9a70f28619b5da5f47330d4e5

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-09 20:57:10.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/08f4135591811494b42f7ab1f7a4ac3caf250a3b', 'message': "Turn debug logging on for beaker jobs

Inexplicably, the current version of beaker defaults to not verbosely
logging its actions. This is a problem when run in a CI environment
because we always want as much information as possible. Setting the
environment variable BEAKER_debug to 'yes' returns the sane behavior.
This variable is documented here[1].

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/wiki/How-to-Write-a-Beaker-Test-for-a-Module#supported-env-variables

commit_message:
Turn debug logging on for beaker jobs

Inexplicably, the current version of beaker defaults to not verbosely
logging its actions. This is a problem when run in a CI environment
because we always want as much information as possible. Setting the
environment variable BEAKER_debug to 'yes' returns the sane behavior.
This variable is documented here[1].

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/wiki/How-to-Write-a-Beaker-Test-for-a-Module#supported-env-variables

Change-Id: Ifd8450803bc8ab8780e81fa74feb0f455ce6be13
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/37/189937/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export BEAKER_debug=yes

commit_message:
Moving Node update earlier in cluster create flow

Moving Node update to happen earlier in the cluster create process, such
that node VM ID is recorded regardless of cluster create success or
failure so that any VMs created during a failed cluster create can be
properly destroyed.

Change-Id: I0c46e18986c615948300b145a9e68bc6607e13ec
Closes-Bug: 1463605

commit_message:
Add port forwarding to VM via port of floating IP

This Spec intends to implement a portforwarding function via floating ip
fip address1:port 22010 -> fixed ip address1: port 22
fip address1:port 22011 -> fixed ip address2: port 22

This function offers the connection to many VMs from public network
by a few floating(global) IPs.

Change-Id: I571427df4f68111c94028165b87bf79fc4a7d904
Blueprint: fip-portforwarding
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/13/158213/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================================================= Add port forwarding to VM via port of floating IP ================================================= Launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/fip-portforwarding Problem Description =================== Floating ips needs global ips. In some cases, global ip run short. Proposed Change =============== This Spec intends to implement a portforwarding function via floating ip. fip address1:port 22010 -> fixed ip address1: port 22 fip address1:port 22011 -> fixed ip address2: port 22 This function offers the connection to many VMs from public network by a few floating(global) IPs. Data Model Impact ----------------- * FloatingIP will be added floating_ipaddr_portno and fixed_ipaddr_portno, fixed_ipaddr_portno .. code-block:: python class FloatingIP(model_base.BASEV2, models_v2.HasId, models_v2.HasTenant): floating_ip_address = sa.Column(sa.String(64), nullable=False) floating_network_id = sa.Column(sa.String(36), nullable=False) floating_port_id = sa.Column(sa.String(36), sa.ForeignKey('ports.id'), nullable=False) fixed_port_id = sa.Column(sa.String(36), sa.ForeignKey('ports.id')) fixed_ip_address = sa.Column(sa.String(64)) router_id = sa.Column(sa.String(36), sa.ForeignKey('routers.id')) last_known_router_id = sa.Column(sa.String(36)) status = sa.Column(sa.String(16)) router = orm.relationship(Router, backref='floating_ips') floating_ipaddr_portno = sa.Column(sa.Integer) fixed_ipaddr_portno = sa.Column(sa.Integer) forward_protocol = sa.Column(sa.String(40)) REST API Impact --------------- * floatingips will be added 'floating_ipaddr_portno', 'fixed_ipaddr_portno', 'forward_protocol'. .. code-block:: python RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP = { ... 'floatingips': { 'id': {'allow_post': False, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:uuid': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'primary_key': True}, 'floating_ip_address': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:ip_address_or_none': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'default': None, 'enforce_policy': True}, 'floating_ipaddr_portno': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:range_or_none': [0, 65535]}, 'convert_to': attr.convert_to_int_if_not_none, 'is_visible': True, 'enforce_policy': True, 'default': None}, 'floating_network_id': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:uuid': None}, 'is_visible': True}, 'router_id': {'allow_post': False, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:uuid_or_none': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'default': None}, 'port_id': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'validate': {'type:uuid_or_none': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'default': None, 'required_by_policy': True}, 'fixed_ip_address': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'validate': {'type:ip_address_or_none': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'default': None}, 'fixed_ipaddr_portno': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:range_or_none': [0, 65535]}, 'convert_to': attr.convert_to_int_if_not_none, 'is_visible': True, 'enforce_policy': True, 'default': None}, 'tenant_id': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': False, 'required_by_policy': True, 'validate': {'type:string': None}, 'is_visible': True}, 'status': {'allow_post': False, 'allow_put': False, 'is_visible': True}, 'forward_protocol': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:values': ['TCP', 'UDP', None]}, 'is_visible': True, 'default': None}, }, ... } Security Impact --------------- None Notifications Impact -------------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- * if a fip is used as portforwading, a fip cant't be associated with fixed port. Performance Impact ------------------ None IPv6 Impact ----------- None Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- None Community Impact ---------------- None Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: oobuchi-shigeki Work Items ---------- 1. Inplement Database updates floatingip table to support that portforwarding 2. Inplement API updates floatingip to support that portforwarding 3. Inplement python-neutronclient changes for CLI 4. Create test case on tempest Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Tempest Tests ------------- The following tests will be added. * API Testing * Allowed users can use the new parameter for portforwarding * Scenario Testing * A created portforwarding is reachable * A created floating ip address is reachable Functional Tests ---------------- The following tests will be added. * Allowed users can use the new parameter for portforwarding API Tests --------- The following tests will be added. * All patterns that parameter is passed/not passed. Documentation Impact ==================== What is the impact on the docs team of this change? Some changes might require donating resources to the docs team to have the documentation updated. Don't repeat details discussed above, but please reference them here. User Documentation ------------------ None Developer Documentation ----------------------- None References ========== None

subject: Restructures authentication for resource providers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-08 05:51:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/3a54f56bdd39d4e7cd2141dcd1ab4305057e624a', 'message': 'redefined source of authentication information

  Workflow to find credentials details from:
  1. The environment ENV[<OS_*]
  2. A RC file located by convention in current user homedir: ~/openrc
  3. Configuration file like keystone.conf or glance.conf (managed by providers,
     for now)

  User/Tenant/Token credentials can be passed but have to come from above list.

  As discussed [1], this removes purposefully the possibility to pass authenti-
  cation details as parameters to an instance of the resource.

  Note: The rc file data is now directly expanded in the environment.

  [1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/063352.html

Change-Id: I0294e57e5a1408ea364182302a734e2292ae0af4
Depends-On: If628f4ad95f3aac3392475d4ea6857fb858f8755
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-13 13:00:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/15469215e1422da04a1fa4e858e44416b2986a23', 'message': 'Refined source of authentication information

  This is base on using interface (module Auth) to provide class methods to
  provider (provider/keystone.rb) instead of relying on class inheritance

commit_message:
Restructures authentication for resource providers

- Uses module Auth defined in openstacklib (see Depends-On)
respectively offering class methods for the providers.
Instead of relying on class inheritance which turned out to cause unnecessary
complexity.
- Also make use of Credentials (see Depends-On) object to keep authentication
details.

Change-Id: I0294e57e5a1408ea364182302a734e2292ae0af4
Depends-On: If628f4ad95f3aac3392475d4ea6857fb858f8755
Implements: blueprint auth-restructure

use tacker_horizon module

commit_message:
Add metadata size tests on the border

This patch adds a test for a 204 when a single metadata item in a POST causes
the backend aggregate constraints check to be on the border.

Background:
Overall metadata size constraint is enforced in the container and
account backends as well as in the proxy controllers.
Whereas the proxy controller can check that constraints are not exceeded
by a single PUT or POST request, the backend checks that constraints are not
exceeded by the aggregate of all PUTs and POSTs.

The change [1] added a test for a 400 when a single metadata item in
a POST causes the backend aggregate constraints check to go over limit.

[1] I1489e29686013cbd3d70283d8756b548aea3c2e1

Change-Id: Iac86ea71240ddde177e625c279c21aef67659d10
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/89/187489/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'x' * (self.max_meta_overall_size - size) # this POST would be ok and the aggregate backend metadata # size is on the border headers = {'X-Container-Meta-k': 'y' * (self.max_meta_overall_size - size - 1)} resp = retry(post, headers) resp.read() self.assertEqual(resp.status, 204) 'z' * (self.max_meta_overall_size - size)}

commit_message:
The hash_cleanup_listdir function should only be called when necessary.

Introduced a conditional that will specify to _finalize_put() whether
the put() method is being called within the context of ECDiskFileWriter.

Included some unit tests that will test the number of calls to
hash_cleanup_listdir() during put(), commit(), and delete()
operations.

Change-Id: I287b2648591fdbf686898dc9047beda80a64da0c

commit_message:
Add additional required RPMs to dev instructions

Changed dev quick start instructions to include installing gcc and
python3-devel as these are required to be present on (at least)
Fedora 21 server.

Change-Id: I576231cc3ecfda6407279b0326dbe54a408a64e0

commit_message:
Add support for image deactivate and reactivate

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Glance-deactivate-image
Adding the api support for these commands.
Deactivate and reactivate image action is done by admin tenant.

- Added admin folder to image tests
- Added support for admin image classes for v1 and v2
- Added config deactivate_image , this feature is not running on
  icehouse
- Added a testcase for image deactivate.

Depends-On: Ia1d3d811bd57d3de16d397cfab341e8d0f17cb69
Change-Id: I7880f0e2646ce8660e035ebaa19a60f5bf271b64
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/00/183700/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def deactivate_image(self, image_id): url = 'v2/images/%s/actions/deactivate' % image_id resp, body = self.post(url, None) self.expected_success(204, resp.status) return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def reactivate_image(self, image_id): url = 'v2/images/%s/actions/reactivate' % image_id resp, body = self.post(url, None) self.expected_success(204, resp.status) return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body)

commit_message:
VMware: Don't raise exception on resize of 0 disk

An exception should not be raised if someone resizes and instance
to a flavor with a zero disk size.

Change-Id: I183740c974c2ba7e0608c28c05fa28a34a5e1966
Fixes-Bug: #1443697

added_lines: def test_migrate_disk_and_power_off(self): self._test_migrate_disk_and_power_off( flavor_root_gb=self._instance.root_gb + 1) def test_migrate_disk_and_power_off_zero_disk_flavor(self): self._instance.root_gb = 0 self._test_migrate_disk_and_power_off(flavor_root_gb=0) def test_migrate_disk_and_power_off_disk_shrink(self): self.assertRaises(exception.InstanceFaultRollback, self._test_migrate_disk_and_power_off, flavor_root_gb=self._instance.root_gb - 1) def _test_migrate_disk_and_power_off(self, fake_get_vm_ref, fake_progress, fake_power_off, fake_resize_vm, fake_resize_disk, fake_get_vmdk_info, fake_remove_ephemerals, flavor_root_gb): flavor = {'root_gb': flavor_root_gb}

'}, {'number': 121, 'created': '2015-03-06 14:06:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/8eed27334703771bb46c333da40aa0dc9df7c6e6', 'message': 'Domain layer for Artifact Repository

Introduces a layered domain model for Artifact Repository designed
similar to the domain model of v2 Images: a number of proxies for
Artifact Objects, their Repositories and collections split into layers
by appropriate functional aspect.

The following layers are added:
 * Database Repository layer - encapsulates DB APIs;
 * Dependencies Layer - encapsulates dependecy management (artifact ids
   are mapped to the actual Artifact References and back);
 * Location Layer - encapsulates store interaction for Blobs (similar to
   location layer of Images API);
 * Updater layer - wraps the collection-based properties of Artifacts
   for proper updates by JSONPatch calls.

Artifact-specific layers are added into "artifacts" subdirectory of
domain package. A gateway which creates layered proxy is added as well.

Implements-blueprint: artifact-repository

Co-Authored-By: Mike Fedosin <mfedosin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Inessa Vasilevskaya <ivasilevskaya@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alexander Tivelkov <ativelkov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I9b6d0e86c6577929230d58e7403fbefab167f36b

'}, {'number': 125, 'created': '2015-03-10 09:50:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/4096b01059e6519afd36701e5aef5564a27aa939', 'message': 'Domain layer for Artifact Repository

Introduces a layered domain model for Artifact Repository designed
similar to the domain model of v2 Images: a number of proxies for
Artifact Objects, their Repositories and collections split into layers
by appropriate functional aspect.

The following layers are added:
 * Database Repository layer - encapsulates DB APIs;
 * Dependencies Layer - encapsulates dependecy management (artifact ids
   are mapped to the actual Artifact References and back);
 * Location Layer - encapsulates store interaction for Blobs (similar to
   location layer of Images API);
 * Updater layer - wraps the collection-based properties of Artifacts
   for proper updates by JSONPatch calls.

Artifact-specific layers are added into "artifacts" subdirectory of
domain package. A gateway which creates layered proxy is added as well.

Implements-blueprint: artifact-repository

Co-Authored-By: Mike Fedosin <mfedosin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Inessa Vasilevskaya <ivasilevskaya@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alexander Tivelkov <ativelkov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I9b6d0e86c6577929230d58e7403fbefab167f36b

commit_message:
Domain layer for Artifact Repository

Introduces a layered domain model for Artifact Repository designed
similar to the domain model of v2 Images: a number of proxies for
Artifact Objects, their Repositories and collections split into layers
by appropriate functional aspect.

The following layers are added:
 * Database Repository layer - encapsulates DB APIs;
 * Dependencies Layer - encapsulates dependecy management (artifact ids
   are mapped to the actual Artifact References and back);
 * Location Layer - encapsulates store interaction for Blobs (similar to
   location layer of Images API);
 * Updater layer - wraps the collection-based properties of Artifacts
   for proper updates by JSONPatch calls.

Artifact-specific layers are added into "artifacts" subdirectory of
domain package. A gateway which creates layered proxy is added as well.

Implements-blueprint: artifact-repository

FastTrack

Co-Authored-By: Mike Fedosin <mfedosin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Inessa Vasilevskaya <ivasilevskaya@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alexander Tivelkov <ativelkov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I9b6d0e86c6577929230d58e7403fbefab167f36b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/98/132898/138 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

while updating l2gateway for kilo code base.

commit_message:
checking the order in update l2gateway

checking the correct order of device and interfaces
while updating l2gateway for kilo code base.

Change-Id: I54e3e7e801b10fca4efc3c895b3656bebbd68536
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-l2gw refs/changes/00/190000/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not interface_data: msg = _("Cannot create a gateway with an empty interfaces") return msg
deleted_lines: if not interface_data: msg = _("Cannot create a gateway with an empty interfaces") return msg

commit_message:
Updates to encryption spec

This patch updates the spec with changes discussed at the
San Francisco hackathon, Feb 2015:
* User metadata names will not be encrypted.
* Detail on storing crypto related metadata for each
  resource.
* Encrypted etags will be sent at end of MIME multipart body.
* Keymaster may set a request environ variable to indicate that
encryption or decryption is not to be applied to a particular
request.

Co-Authored-By: Janie Richling <jrichli@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I2b7a77e6161650aaf2219e7ca92068e19831da9a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift-specs refs/changes/18/154318/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Goal 2: when a keymaster implementation allows for secure deletion of keys, then the deletion of an object's key shall render the object irrecoverable. This provides a means to securely delete an object.The keymaster is responsible for deciding if any particular resource should be encrypted. This decision is implementation dependent but may be based, for example, on container policy or account name. When a resource is not to be encrypted the keymaster will set the key `encryption.override` in the request environ to indicate to the encrypter middleware that encryption is not required. When encryption is required, the keymaster communicates the encryption key to the encrypter and decrypter middlewares by placing a zero-argument callable in the WSGI environment dictionary at the key "swift.crypto.fetch_crypto_keys". When called, this will return the key(s) necessary to process the current request. It must be present on any GET or HEAD request for an account, container, or object which contains any encrypted data or metadata. If encrypted data or metadata is encountered while processing a GET or HEAD request but fetch_crypto_keys is not present _or_ it does not return keys when called, then this is an error and the client will receive a 500-series response.Not only the contents of an object are sensitive; metadata is sensitive too. User metadata will be encrypted with the same key and IV as the rest of the metadata. Since metadata values must be valid UTF-8 strings, the encrypted values will be suitably encoded (probably base64) for storage. Since this encoding may increase the size of user metadata values beyond the allowed limits, the metadata limit checking will need to be implemented by the encrypter middleware.That way, users don't see lower metadata-size limits when encryption is in use. The encrypter middleware will set a request environ key `constraints.override` to indicate to the proxy-server that limit checking has already been applied."X-Object-Meta-Preferred-Contraband-Vendor: Y7JF30oF5TXTeEIqOu8=" Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: jrichli@us.ibm.com alistair.coles@hp.com
deleted_lines: Goal 2: it should be possible to completely remove an object so that it cannot be recovered by deleting the key. This requires support from the keymaster for key deletion. This provides a guarantee that an object is not retained (in a recoverable form) any longer than necessary.The keymaster communicates the encryption key to the encrypter and decrypter middlewares by placing a zero-argument callable in the WSGI environment dictionary at the key "swift.crypto.fetch_crypto_keys". When called, this will return the key(s) necessary to process the current request. It must be present on any GET or HEAD request for an account, container, or object which contains any encrypted data or metadata. If encrypted data or metadata is encountered while processing a GET or HEAD request but fetch_crypto_keys is not present _or_ it does not return keys when called, then this is an error and the client will receive a 500-series response.Not only the contents of an object are sensitive; metadata is sensitive too. User metadata will be encrypted with the same key and IV as the rest of the metadata. Since metadata values must be valid UTF-8 strings, the encrypted values will be suitably encoded (probably base64) for storage. In order to preserve the current user-metadata length limits despite the bloat caused by encoding, the encrypter will actually store the ciphertext of the user's metadata values in system metadata. That way, users don't see lower metadata-size limits when encryption is in use. This means that the encrypter is responsible for enforcing user-metadata limits on encrypted objects, as it is the last entity in the middleware pipeline to see plaintext user metadata."X-Object-Sysmeta-UM-Preferred-Contraband-Vendor: Y7JF30oF5TXTeEIqOu8="

commit_message:
Add InvalidIpForSubnetClient exception

A new Neutron exception type, InvalidIpForSubnetClient, is added by
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/121767/ . Need to let Neutron client to
identify this new exception type.

Change-Id: Ib4f0d7af3807f96463c82d1d2a1e53b56081facc
Partial-Bug: 1369871

commit_message:
Revocation engine refactoring

Rewritten RevokeTree.is_revoked method to be more readable
and use less dynamic objects.
Recursion is used.

Implements bp revoke-tree-refactoring

Change-Id: I77fea330ee64f42c80ac7010a0c4dc4b8cbdfb07
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/31/188131/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Alternative names to be checked in token for every field in # revoke tree. ALTERNATIVES = { 'user_id': ['user_id', 'trustor_id', 'trustee_id'], 'domain_id': ['identity_domain_id', 'assignment_domain_id'], # For a domain-scoped token, the domain is in assignment_domain_id. 'domain_scope_id': ['assignment_domain_id', ], } for name in _EVENT_NAMES: revoke_map = revoke_map.setdefault(event.key_for_name(name), {}) event.issued_before, revoke_map.get('issued_before', event.issued_before) ) @staticmethod def _next_level_keys(name, token_data): """Generate keys based on current field name and token data Generate all keys to look for in the next iteration of revocation event tree traversal. """ yield '*' if name == 'role_id': # Roles are very special since a token has a list of them. # If the revocation event matches any one of them, # revoke the token. for role_id in token_data.get('roles', []): yield role_id else: # For other fields we try to get any branch that concur # with any alternative field in the token. for alt_name in ALTERNATIVES.get(name, [name]): yield token_data[alt_name] def _search(self, revoke_map, names, token_data): """Search for revocation event by token_data Traverse the revocation events tree looking for event matching token data issued after the token. """ if not names: # The last (leaf) level is checked in a special way because we # verify issued_at field differently. try: return revoke_map['issued_before'] > token_data['issued_at'] except KeyError: return False name, remaining_names = names[0], names[1:] for key in self._next_level_keys(name, token_data): subtree = revoke_map.get('%s=%s' % (name, key)) if subtree and self._search(subtree, remaining_names, token_data): return True # If we made it out of the loop then no element in revocation tree # corresponds to our token and it is good. return False return self._search(self.revoke_map, _EVENT_NAMES, token_data)
deleted_lines: def attr_keys(event): return list(map(event.key_for_name, _EVENT_NAMES)) for key in attr_keys(event): revoke_map = revoke_map.setdefault(key, {}) event.issued_before, revoke_map.get( 'issued_before', event.issued_before)) # Alternative names to be checked in token for every field in # revoke tree. alternatives = { 'user_id': ['user_id', 'trustor_id', 'trustee_id'], 'domain_id': ['identity_domain_id', 'assignment_domain_id'], # For a domain-scoped token, the domain is in assignment_domain_id. 'domain_scope_id': ['assignment_domain_id', ], } # Contains current forest (collection of trees) to be checked. partial_matches = [self.revoke_map] # We iterate over every layer of our revoke tree (except the last one). for name in _EVENT_NAMES: # bundle is the set of partial matches for the next level down # the tree bundle = [] wildcard = '%s=*' % (name,) # For every tree in current forest. for tree in partial_matches: # If there is wildcard node on current level we take it. bundle.append(tree.get(wildcard)) if name == 'role_id': # Roles are very special since a token has a list of them. # If the revocation event matches any one of them, # revoke the token. for role_id in token_data.get('roles', []): bundle.append(tree.get('role_id=%s' % role_id)) else: # For other fields we try to get any branch that concur # with any alternative field in the token. for alt_name in alternatives.get(name, [name]): bundle.append( tree.get('%s=%s' % (name, token_data[alt_name]))) # tree.get returns `None` if there is no match, so `bundle.append` # adds a 'None' entry. This call remoes the `None` entries. partial_matches = [x for x in bundle if x is not None] if not partial_matches: # If we end up with no branches to follow means that the token # is definitely not in the revoke tree and all further # iterations will be for nothing. return False # The last (leaf) level is checked in a special way because we verify # issued_at field differently. for leaf in partial_matches: try: if leaf['issued_before'] > token_data['issued_at']: return True except KeyError: pass # If we made it out of the loop then no element in revocation tree # corresponds to our token and it is good. return False

commit_message:
Break Pinger class to functions

As the class served only for storing parameters that can be passed as
actual function parameters, there is no reason for class.

Change-Id: I553b4d6daeb78d495cda09894582a3d885b5d1b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/74/189774/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def assert_ping(src_namespace, dst_ip, timeout=1, count=1): ipversion = netaddr.IPAddress(dst_ip).version ping_command = 'ping' if ipversion == 4 else 'ping6' ns_ip_wrapper = ip_lib.IPWrapper(src_namespace) ns_ip_wrapper.netns.execute([ping_command, '-c', count, '-W', timeout, dst_ip]) def assert_no_ping(src_namespace, dst_ip, timeout=1, count=1): try: assert_ping(src_namespace, dst_ip, timeout, count) except RuntimeError: pass else: tools.fail("destination ip %(destination)s is replying to ping from " "namespace %(ns)s, but it shouldn't" % {'ns': src_namespace, 'destination': dst_ip})

commit_message:
Add a comment on _check_update_has_security_groups

Despite of its name, _check_update_has_security_groups can
handle create requests as well.  There are plugins actually
using it for create.  eg. ml2, vmware

Change-Id: I3c26ad0ac00b12ce24096bfc27606797af2d9098

commit_message:
Merge tag '2015.1.0'

This is a null-merge of the 2015.1.0 release tag back into the master
branch so that the 2015.1.0 tag will appear in the git commit history of
the master branch. It contains no actual changes to the master branch,
regardless of how our code review system's UI represents it. Please
ask in #openstack-infra if you have any questions, and otherwise try
to merge this as quickly as possible to avoid later conflicts on the
master branch.

Change-Id: Iba4587072d48836ee0d5cf7bf9b176bd0c2d6545

commit_message:
LBaaS v2: Fix listing pool members

The command `neutron lbaas-member-list POOLID` should list members that
belong to a given pool. Instead, it lists all members for all pools.
This patch corrects this behavior.

Change-Id: Ida80e17831865924a0e114417371faa437cce2ba
Closes-Bug: #1454986
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/63/183563/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_data(self, parsed_args): self.parent_id = _get_pool_id(self.get_client(), parsed_args.pool) self.values_specs.append('--pool_id=%s' % self.parent_id) return super(ListMember, self).get_data(parsed_args)

subject: Restructures authentication for resource providers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-06 05:49:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/commit/35eaba82748d0932fb73242956b373294c492144', 'message': 'Predefined source of authentication information

  Workflow to find credentials details from:
  1. The environment ENV[<OS_*]
  2. A RC file located by convention in current user homedir: ~/openstackrc
  3. Configuration file like keystone.conf or glance.conf (managed by providers,
     for now)

  User/Tenant/Token credentials can be passed but have to come from above list.

  As discussed [1], this removes purposefully the possibility to pass authenti-
  cation details as parameters to an instance of the resource.

  Note: The openstackrc data is now directly expended in the environment.

  Review for puppet-keystone to follow suit.

  [1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/063352.html

Change-Id: If628f4ad95f3aac3392475d4ea6857fb858f8755

'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2015-05-09 02:29:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/commit/99fcf9d09cf37e0a4ff537cc53a34040e3a74b62', 'message': 'Predefined source of authentication information

  Workflow to find credentials details from:
  1. The environment ENV[<OS_*]
  2. A RC file located by convention in current user homedir: ~/openrc
  3. Configuration file like keystone.conf or glance.conf (managed by providers,
     for now)

  User/Tenant/Token credentials can be passed but have to come from above list.

  The resource provider can use auth_override_hash to create a blank
  environment hash, then use withenv authentication_env(hash) to execute
  authenticate_request with custom or override parameters.

  As discussed [1], this removes purposefully the possibility to pass authenti-
  cation details as parameters to an instance of the resource.

  Note: The rc file data is now directly expanded in the environment.

  Review for puppet-keystone to follow suit.

  [1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/063352.html

Change-Id: If628f4ad95f3aac3392475d4ea6857fb858f8755
Implements: blueprint auth-consolidation
'}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2015-05-10 21:17:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/commit/753ea56dd0c3984918e9aa952a3ff1934cef830e', 'message': "Predefined source of authentication information

  Workflow to find credentials details from:
  1. A RC file located by convention in current user homedir: ~/openrc
  2. Configuration file like keystone.conf or glance.conf (managed by providers,
     for now)
  3. The environment ENV['OS_*']
  4. An override from the resource provider.
  The numbers define the precedence.  For example, parameters specified in
  the application config file override parameters specified in the RC file.
  Parameters in the environment override both the app config and the RC.
  The override parameters override everything else.

  User/Tenant/Token credentials can be passed but have to come from above list.

  The resource provider can use auth_override_hash to create a blank
  environment hash, then use withenv authentication_env(hash) to execute
  authenticate_request with custom or override parameters.

  The Keystone authentication parameters are passed to the openstack command
  in the environment.  The withenv method is used to guarantee that the
  global environment is not polluted by each command invocation.

  As discussed [1], this removes purposefully the possibility to pass authenti-
  cation details as parameters to an instance of the resource.

  Note: The rc file data is now directly expanded in the environment.

  Review for puppet-keystone to follow suit.

  [1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/063352.html

Change-Id: If628f4ad95f3aac3392475d4ea6857fb858f8755
Implements: blueprint auth-consolidation

  This uses interface (module Auth) to provide class methods to providers
  instead of relying on class inheritance.
      w
  As discussed [1], this removes purposefully the possibility to pass authenti-
  cation details as parameters to an instance of the resource.

  Note: The rc file data is now directly expanded in the environment.

"}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2015-05-14 05:54:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/commit/27ef2791dfb1dd48e5c60a63df496bbfbb29c01f', 'message': "Refined source of authentication information

  Workflow to find credentials details from:

  1. The environment ENV['OS_*']
  2. A RC file located by convention in current user homedir: ~/openrc
  3. Configuration file like keystone.conf or glance.conf managed by providers

  Defines module Auth to provide class methods to providers instead of relying
  on puppet::provider::openstack inheritance.
  As discussed [1], this purposefully removes the possibility to pass authenti-
  cation details as parameters to resources instances.

  RC file data is now directly expanded in the environment

  Review for puppet-keystone needs to be merged at same time:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/181299/

  [1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/063352.html

Change-Id: If628f4ad95f3aac3392475d4ea6857fb858f8755
Implements: blueprint auth-consolidation
"}, {'number': 15, 'created': '2015-05-14 07:13:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/commit/2b3fb4b414fb6c146917e8c23e48ac8b5888da3d', 'message': "Refined source of authentication information

  1. The environment ENV['OS_*']
  2. A RC file located by convention in current user homedir: ~/openrc
  3. Configuration file like keystone.conf or glance.conf managed by providers

  Defines module Auth to provide class methods to providers instead of relying
  on puppet::provider::openstack inheritance.
  As discussed [1], this purposefully removes the possibility to pass authenti-
  cation details as parameters to resources instances.

  RC file data is now directly expanded in the environment

  Review for puppet-keystone needs to be merged at same time:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/181299/

  [1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/063352.html

  Workflow to find credentials details from:

  1. The environment ENV['OS_*']
  2. A RC file located by convention in current user homedir: ~/openrc
  3. Configuration file like keystone.conf or glance.conf managed by providers

  Defines module Auth to provide class methods to providers instead of relying
  on puppet::provider::openstack inheritance.
  As discussed [1], this purposefully removes the possibility to pass authenti-
  cation details as parameters to resources instances.

  RC file data is now directly expanded in the environment

  Review for puppet-keystone needs to be merged at same time:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/181299/

  [1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/063352.html

  Workflow to find credentials details from:

  1. The environment ENV['OS_*']
  2. A RC file located by convention in current user homedir: ~/openrc
  3. Configuration file like keystone.conf or glance.conf managed by providers

  - Adds module Puppet::Provider::Openstack::Auth providing class methods for
  providers instead of relying on superclass inheritance.
  As discussed [1], this purposefully removes the possibility to pass authenti-
  cation details as parameters to Puppet resources instances.

  - Adds Puppet::Provider::Openstack::API class handling API version

  - RC file data is now directly expanded in the environment

  Review for puppet-keystone needs to be merged at same time:

"}, {'number': 34, 'created': '2015-05-27 05:02:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/commit/80752d538a79a69966cbf519674696abae647465', 'message': "Refined authentication sources

  Workflow to find credentials details from:
  1. The environment variables (ENV['OS_*'])
  2. If not enough, credentials available from the environment RC file
     to be used. Default RC file must be in current user homedir: ~/openrc

  - Adds module Puppet::Provider::Openstack::Auth providing class methods for
  providers instead of relying on superclass inheritance.
  As discussed [1], this purposefully removes the possibility to pass authenti-
  cation details as parameters to Puppet resources instances.

  - Wraps credentials information with object:
    Puppet::Provider::Openstack::Credentials

  - The credentials information is used in a withenv block

  Review for puppet-keystone needs to be merged at same time:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/181299/

  [1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/063352.html

Change-Id: If628f4ad95f3aac3392475d4ea6857fb858f8755
Implements: blueprint auth-consolidation

commit_message:
Restructures authentication for resource providers

  Workflow to find credentials details from:
  1. The environment variables (ENV['OS_*'])
  2. If not enough, credentials available from the environment RC file
     to be used. Default RC file must be in current user homedir: ~/openrc

  - Adds module Puppet::Provider::Openstack::Auth providing class methods for
  providers instead of relying on superclass inheritance.
  As discussed [1], this purposefully removes the possibility to pass authenti-
  cation details as parameters to Puppet resources instances.

  - Wraps credentials information with object:
    Puppet::Provider::Openstack::Credentials

  - The credentials information is used in a withenv block

  Review for puppet-keystone needs to be merged at same time:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/181299/

  [1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/063352.html

Change-Id: If628f4ad95f3aac3392475d4ea6857fb858f8755
Implements: blueprint auth-restructure

ENV['OS_USERNAME'] && ENV['OS_PASSWORD'] && ENV['OS_PROJECT_NAME'] && ENV['OS_AUTH_URL'] end def env_vars_set? self.class.env_vars_set? end def self.password_auth_args(credentials) creds = [ '--os-username', credentials['username'], '--os-password', credentials['password'], '--os-project-name', credentials['project_name'], '--os-auth-url', credentials['auth_url'] ] if credentials.include?('project_domain_name') creds << '--os-project-domain-name' creds << credentials['project_domain_name'] if credentials.include?('user_domain_name') creds << '--os-user-domain-name' creds << credentials['user_domain_name'] end creds def password_auth_args(credentials) self.class.password_auth_args(credentials) end def self.token_auth_args(credentials) args = [ '--os-token', credentials['token'], '--os-url', credentials['url'] ] # Add the api version only if requested by the caller if credentials['version'] args << [ '--os-identity-api-version', credentials['version'] ] end args end def token_auth_args(credentials) self.class.token_auth_args(credentials) end def get_credentials_from_openrc(file) creds = {} key = key.split(' ').last.downcase.sub(/^os_/, '') creds[key] = value return creds end def self.get_credentials_from_env env = ENV.to_hash.dup.delete_if { |key, _| ! (key =~ /^OS_/) } credentials = {} env.each do |name, value| credentials[name.downcase.sub(/^os_/, '')] = value end credentials end def get_credentials_from_env self.class.get_credentials_from_env

subject: Fix _quota_reserve test setup for incompatible type checking
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-04 02:00:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/27236e3d6ab163c9032463b781b125ed62cd8afd', 'message': "Fix _quota_reserve test setup for incompatible type checking

The db.quota_reserve() method expects to get project_quotas and
user_quotas as dicts that map resource types to limits which are ints.

The _quota_reserve test setup method was just mapping the resource type
to the Quota sqlalchemy dict-like object that was coming back from
db.quota_create. Since db._calculate_overquota compares the delta (int)
to the user_quotas/project_quotas value, which was a Quota object, and
py34 doesn't allow incompatible type checks like that, this fails with
py34.

This fixes the _quota_reserve test setup method to map the resource type
to the hard_limit like the actual DB APIs do in the normal nova.quota
flows.  It also has to adjust the setup method to avoid going over-quota
immediately due to the limit and usage being the same (which is why we
add a buffer to the i value for the limit).

Closes-Bug: #1461665

Change-Id: I9f5f537eff58fe83caa7bff2fb0800ce9f7272fa
"}]
commit_message:
Fix _quota_reserve test setup for incompatible type checking

The db.quota_reserve() method expects to get project_quotas and
user_quotas as dicts that map resource types to limits which are ints.

The _quota_reserve test setup method was just mapping the resource type
to the Quota sqlalchemy dict-like object that was coming back from
db.quota_create. Since db._calculate_overquota compares the delta (int)
to the user_quotas/project_quotas value, which was a Quota object, and
py34 doesn't allow incompatible type checks like that, this fails with
py34.

This fixes the _quota_reserve test setup method to map the resource type
to the hard_limit like the actual DB APIs do in the normal nova.quota
flows.  It also has to adjust the setup method to avoid going over-quota
immediately due to the limit and usage being the same (which is why we
add a buffer to the i value for the limit).

Closes-Bug: #1461665

Change-Id: I9f5f537eff58fe83caa7bff2fb0800ce9f7272fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/31/188231/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: project_id, resource, i) project_id, resource, i) resource, i, user_id=user_id) resource.name, 100)

commit_message:
devstack: unzip -u may wait for user input

When there is an existing opendaylight package expanded,
unzip -u may wait for user input without any input.
For automation, it should overwrite without prompting.
So -o (overwrite existing files without prompting) should be
used for zunip.

Change-Id: Ic85ba531797a4f394bb8e47222bd97dc9300f65d
Closes-Bug: #1463558
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/33/189933/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: unzip -u -o $ODL_PKG

commit_message:
devstack: OFFLINE=True is ignored

Even if OFFLINE=True, plugin.sh tries to access to the internet.
It shouldn't download any from the internet when OFFLINE=True.
As a bonus, it doesn't update opendaylight karaf package when
unnecessary.

Closes-Bug: #1463529
Change-Id: I38ead6e9c8738ed6979f07fedaeb0bf88d5f3e86

commit_message:
Modify GetResourceErrorStatus exception

Variable "fault" was not used in exception message. It produced unclear
error messages, like:
   Resource <Server: rally_novaserver_aKO6sw5xHdOPZbEC> has ERROR status:

The end of such messages looks unfinished.

Proposed change removes this variable from exception message at all.

Change-Id: Ic27ace0fdc6eea2ee8d437fc2a0efc10d0b8e960
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/77/189777/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-17 12:23:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/1bf596e51dbd5dae2a9fcf4d4c4065852008328d', 'message': "Adding support for Keepalived health check script.

Currently we have no way of conditioning an HA router's
state with a custom events.
This is needed in some scenarios that require tracking a
specific entity (i.e. pinging a host's interface) or event
(i.e. a process that is no longer running).

This patch adds the ablitiy to hook user-defined scripts
that will be executed every interval (currently 2 sec).

These script's exit code is used by keepalived to either
change the VR to FAULT state (script failed) or to BACKUP
state (script successful).

The script file is defined in 'l3_agent.ini' under the new
parameter 'ha_health_check_script_path'. the file
specified in that parameter value will be used by keepalived
as a 'track_script' to be ran every 'interval' seconds.

Change-Id: I43b285e164f346b7b7f2ab99bc3272e2527cf171

Currently we have no way of conditioning an HA router's
state with a custom events.
This is needed in some scenarios that require tracking a
specific entity (i.e. pinging a host's interface) or event
(i.e. a process that is no longer running).

This patch adds the ablitiy to hook user-defined scripts
that will be executed every interval (currently 2 sec).

These script's exit code is used by keepalived to either
change the VR to FAULT state (script failed) or to BACKUP
state (script successful).

"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-18 06:59:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5ec9d772fbf0c43c06d9e83a2c47e33b20c4a9de', 'message': "Adding support for Keepalived health check script.

Currently we have no way of conditioning an HA router's
state with a custom events.
This is needed in some scenarios that require tracking a
specific entity (i.e. pinging a host's interface) or event
(i.e. a process that is no longer running).

This patch adds the ablitiy to hook user-defined scripts
that will be executed every interval (currently 2 sec).

These script's exit code is used by keepalived to either
change the VR to FAULT state (script returned '0') or 
to BACKUP state (script returned value other then '0').

The script file is defined in 'l3_agent.ini' under the new
parameter 'ha_health_check_script_path'. the file
specified in that parameter value will be used by keepalived
as a 'track_script' to be ran every 'interval' seconds.

Closes-Bug: #1365461
DocImpact:
The 'l3_agent.ini' config file can take a parameter
'ha_health_check_script_path' which should contain a 
full path to a bash script that behaves as detailed 
in the commit message.
Change-Id: I43b285e164f346b7b7f2ab99bc3272e2527cf171

"}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-18 07:52:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/fdadd0e6d132568b70f130e8d4999a12b641a741', 'message': "Adding support for Keepalived health check script.

Currently we have no way of conditioning an HA router's
state with a custom events.
This is needed in some scenarios that require tracking a
specific entity (i.e. pinging a host's interface) or event
(i.e. a process that is no longer running).

This patch adds the ablitiy to hook user-defined scripts
that will be executed every interval (currently 2 sec).

These script's exit code is used by keepalived to either
change the VR to FAULT state (script exited with
value other then '0' - fail) or to BACKUP state (script
exited with '0' - success).

The script file is defined in 'l3_agent.ini' under the new
parameter 'ha_health_check_script_path'. the file
specified in that parameter value will be used by keepalived
as a 'track_script' to be ran every 'interval' seconds.

DocImpact:
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_check_script_path' that can accept a full path
of a bash script. The script behavior should match the
details in this commit message above.

Change-Id: I43b285e164f346b7b7f2ab99bc3272e2527cf171
"}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2015-02-19 06:35:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2a82a93aa7ddea0ed87747b1e4ef58d32d28e8bd', 'message': "Adding support for Keepalived health check script.

Currently we have no way of conditioning an HA router's
state with a custom events.
This is needed in some scenarios that require tracking a
specific entity (i.e. pinging a host's interface) or event
(i.e. a process that is no longer running).

This patch adds the ablitiy to hook user-defined scripts
that will be executed every interval (currently 2 sec).

These script's exit code is used by keepalived to
change the VR to FAULT state (script exited with
value other then '0' - fail)

If the VR is currently in FAULT state and the script
exited with code '0' (success) then the VR will move to
BACKUP. If the VR is MASTER and the script succeeds the
VR will remain MASTER.

The script file is defined in 'l3_agent.ini' under the new
parameter 'ha_health_check_script_path'. the file
specified in that parameter value will be used by keepalived
as a 'track_script' to be ran every 'interval' seconds.

DocImpact:
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_check_script_path' that can accept a full path
of a bash script. The script behavior should match the
details in this commit message above.

Change-Id: I43b285e164f346b7b7f2ab99bc3272e2527cf171

commit_message:
Adding support for Keepalived health check script

Currently we have no way of conditioning an HA router's
state with a custom events.
This is needed in some scenarios that require tracking a
specific entity (i.e. pinging a host's interface) or event
(i.e. a process that is no longer running).

This patch adds the ablitiy to hook user-defined scripts
that will be executed every interval (currently 2 sec).

These script's exit code is used by keepalived to
change the VR to FAULT state (script exited with
value other then '0' - fail)

If the VR is currently in FAULT state and the script
exited with code '0' (success) then the VR will move to
BACKUP. If the VR is MASTER and the script succeeds the
VR will remain MASTER.

The script file is defined in 'l3_agent.ini' under the new
parameter 'ha_health_check_script_path'. the file
specified in that parameter value will be used by keepalived
as a 'track_script' to be ran according to the new
'ha_health_check_script_interval' parameter in
'l3_agent.ini'. This parameter has a default value of
5 seconds.

DocImpact:
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_check_script_path' that can accept a full path
of a bash script. The script behavior should match the
details in this commit message above.
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_check_script_interval' which will determine
the VRRP health check interval in seconds.

Closes-Bug: #1365461

Change-Id: I43b285e164f346b7b7f2ab99bc3272e2527cf171
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/63/156563/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Test IP allocation in two SLAAC subnets

Test creates two stateless IPv6 subnets and check that each IP in
these subnets is SLAAC and calculated from MAC address.
DDT support was added according to agreement with Marc and Mathew

Closes-Bug: 1358709
Change-Id: Id6476923d527830123a8a3a650e24fb59ad15dde
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/29/167129/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from ddt import data from ddt import ddt from ddt import unpack@ddt @data(('slaac', 'slaac'), ('dhcpv6-stateless', 'dhcpv6-stateless')) @test.idempotent_id('65a0a623-f37a-4707-8dd6-9e7d41896f64') @unpack def test_dhcpv6_stateless_two_subnets(self, ra_mode, add_mode): """When 2 subnets configured with dnsmasq SLAAC and DHCP stateless and there is radvd, port shall receive IP addresses calculated from its MAC and mask of subnet from both subnets. """ kwargs = {'ipv6_ra_mode': ra_mode, 'ipv6_address_mode': add_mode} subnet1 = self.create_subnet(self.network, **kwargs) subnet2 = self.create_subnet(self.network, **kwargs) port_mac = data_utils.rand_mac_address() port = self.create_port(self.network, mac_address=port_mac) real_ips = [i['ip_address'] for i in port['fixed_ips']] eui_ips = [ data_utils.get_ipv6_addr_by_EUI64(i['cidr'], port_mac).format() for i in (subnet1, subnet2) ] self._clean_network() self.assertSequenceEqual(sorted(real_ips), sorted(eui_ips), ('Real port IPs %s,%s are not equal to' ' SLAAC IPs: %s,%s') % tuple(real_ips + eui_ips))

commit_message:
Anuta NCX mechanism driver

This driver acts as a proxy for plugin that runs inside the NCX server.
This driver simply redirects the network, subnet and port action payload to NCX server using NCX RestAPI.

Change-Id: I62d8ba3db0215a8746c5d34c198a9d06aad7d9ce
Implements: NCX mechanism driver
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/52/179552/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Anuta Networks International LLC # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log from oslo_serialization import jsonutils import requests from keystoneclient.v2_0 import client as keystone_client from neutron.common import constants as const from neutron.plugins.ml2 import driver_api as api LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) ncx_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('ncx_host', help="HTTPS URL of NCX REST interface."), cfg.StrOpt('ncx_username', help="NCX username for authentication"), cfg.StrOpt('ncx_password', secret=True, help="NCX password for authentication"), cfg.BoolOpt('ignore_ncx_ssl_certificate', default=False, help="Validate NCX SSL certificate"), cfg.IntOpt('ncx_resp_timeout', default=60, help="HTTPS timeout in seconds.") ] cfg.CONF.register_opts(ncx_opts, "ml2_ncx") class NCXMechanismDriver(api.MechanismDriver): def initialize(self): self.url = cfg.CONF.ml2_ncx.ncx_host self.username = cfg.CONF.ml2_ncx.ncx_username self.password = cfg.CONF.ml2_ncx.ncx_password self.timeout = cfg.CONF.ml2_ncx.ncx_resp_timeout self.verifysslcert = not cfg.CONF.ml2_ncx.ignore_ncx_ssl_certificate required_opts = ('url', 'username', 'password') for opt in required_opts: if not getattr(self, opt): raise cfg.RequiredOptError(opt, 'ml2_ncx') def create_network_postcommit(self, context): self.request_ncx('create', 'network', context) def update_network_postcommit(self, context): self.request_ncx('update', 'network', context) def delete_network_postcommit(self, context): self.request_ncx('delete', 'network', context) def create_subnet_postcommit(self, context): self.request_ncx('create', 'subnet', context) def update_subnet_postcommit(self, context): self.request_ncx('update', 'subnet', context) def delete_subnet_postcommit(self, context): self.request_ncx('delete', 'subnet', context) def create_port_postcommit(self, context): self.request_ncx('create', 'port', context) self.update_port_status(context) def update_port_postcommit(self, context): self.request_ncx('update', 'port', context) def delete_port_postcommit(self, context): self.request_ncx('delete', 'port', context) @staticmethod def get_tenant_name(tenantid): tenant_name = "" if tenantid is not None and tenantid != "": keystone_conf = cfg.CONF.keystone_authtoken auth_url = keystone_conf.auth_uri user = keystone_conf.admin_user pw = keystone_conf.admin_password admintenantname = keystone_conf.admin_tenant_name kc = keystone_client.Client(username=user, password=pw, tenant_name=admintenantname, auth_url=auth_url) tenant_name = kc.tenants.get(tenantid).name return tenant_name def request_ncx(self, operation, object_type, context): tenantname = self.get_tenant_name(context.current['tenant_id']) obj = context.current self.send_to_ncx({'action': operation, 'resource': object_type, 'tenant_name': tenantname, 'parameters': obj}) def send_to_ncx(self, data): headers = {"Content-Type": "application/json", "Accept": "application/json", "APIVersion": "1.0"} if data is None: jsondata = None else: jsondata = jsonutils.dumps(data, indent=2) auth = None if self.username and self.password: auth = (self.username, self.password) if self.url: resturl = '/'.join([self.url, 'rest/openstack/createservice']) ncxresponse = requests.post(resturl, headers=headers, data=jsondata, auth=auth, timeout=self.timeout, verify=self.verifysslcert) ncxresponse.raise_for_status() @staticmethod def update_port_status(context): device_owner = context.current['device_owner'] if (device_owner == const.DEVICE_OWNER_FLOATINGIP or device_owner == const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_GW or device_owner == const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF): dbcontext = context._plugin_context port_id = context.current['id'] newstatus = const.PORT_STATUS_ACTIVE if device_owner == const.DEVICE_OWNER_FLOATINGIP: newstatus = const.FLOATINGIP_STATUS_ACTIVE context._plugin.update_port_status(dbcontext, port_id, newstatus)

commit_message:
Add service group as a firewall customized service

This patch introduces reference implementation,
currently firewall rule can refer multiple service groups to allow the
user flexibilty to define their own groups and use them without impacting
the other users.

More info can be found at service group wiki
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron/FWaaS/FWaaS-ServiceGroup
Implements: blueprint fwaas-customized-service for customized service
Authored-by: badveli vishnuvardhan <badveli_vishnuus@yahoo.com>

Change-Id: I18f69917027f2c5ba3f00fbacb1c8a242c8cf06f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/76/161076/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
To give proper reason during delete-port with VIP associated

When an VIP is associated with particular subnet and when an port is
deleted, 500 internal server error is thrown. This fix will give
proper error message.

Closes-Bug: #1430394
Change-Id: I28bdb7f3bf4219ec9856d8a89d73b1bdfce8fb38
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/21/180421/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: delay fip namespace cleanup/destroy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-30 20:26:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f08dc870be359245cc3d528a0f21d65857847854', 'message': 'WIP delay fip namespace cleanup/destroy

The agent_gateway_port and fip-ns are shared resources
across ext-networds and routers for a given agent.  While
debugging intermittent failures on the dvr experimental
job, traces indicate there may be a race condition between
when these shared resources are beeing added and deleted.

This patch does 2 things to debug and resolve the race
condition:
1. Delays destroying the objects via fullsync
2. Validates destroying the namespace by scanning for
remaining ports.

This patch is very much a WIP and is mostly being used
to isolate the race condition above.

Related-bug: #1415522

Change-Id: Iade09e4d3ae329e5c9d3c70ac9802b262b9f727f

job, traces indicate there may be a race condition between
when these shared resources are beeing added and deleted.

This patch does 2 things to debug and resolve the race
condition:
1. Delays destroying the objects via fullsync
2. Validates destroying the namespace by scanning for
remaining ports.

This patch is very much a WIP and is mostly being used
to isolate the race condition above.

Related-bug: #1415522

Change-Id: Iade09e4d3ae329e5c9d3c70ac9802b262b9f727f

commit_message:
delay fip namespace cleanup/destroy

The agent_gateway_port and fip-ns are shared resources
across ext-networks and routers for a given agent.  While
debugging intermittent failures on the dvr experimental
job, traces indicate there may be a race condition between
when these shared resources are beeing added and deleted.

This patch does the following to debug and resolve the race
condition:
1. Delays destroying the objects via fullsync for FIP
delete or dissassociate.  Router delete is the only
other time when the fip namespace will possibly be destroyed.
This should reduce the churn of port and ns creation and
deletion.
2. Validates destroying the namespace by checking the
fip_ns object subscribe list.  This list is used by
any router which uses the fip_ns object.

Related-bug: #1415522

Change-Id: Iade09e4d3ae329e5c9d3c70ac9802b262b9f727f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/58/151758/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug('DVR: setting fullsync to destroy fip ns: %s', ns) self.fullsync = True
deleted_lines: LOG.debug('DVR: destroy fip ns: %s', ns) # TODO(mrsmith): add LOG warn if fip count != 0 if self.conf.router_delete_namespaces: self._delete_namespace(ns_ip, ns) self.agent_gateway_port = None

'}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2015-05-08 17:27:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/a7f99b722af378b5090fb1c4e0af342cda1b42f9', 'message': "Define TcNatDriver stateless nat driver

This change defines TcNatDriver: driver to manage tc-based (stateless)
nat and neutron.agent.linux.tc_lib module. This module provides low
level drivers to manage ingress/egress nat filters in tc.

Stateless nat doesn't support to reach natted ports/vms from internal
networks using their floating ips because stateless nat is not able to
differentiate natted/non-natted traffics (it always rewrites natted
ports/vms egress traffics). A follow-up change will define an hybrid nat
driver to use stateless nat for north/south traffic and stateful nat for
east/west traffic.

Related-Bug: #1334926
Partially-Implements: blueprint stateless-floatingips
Change-Id: Id2e8c084381c8552e7f8641724ca083aaa23cb01

commit_message:
Define TcNatDriver stateless nat driver

This change defines TcNatDriver: driver to manage tc-based (stateless)
nat and neutron.agent.linux.tc_lib module. This module provides low
level drivers to manage ingress/egress nat filters in tc.

Stateless nat doesn't support to reach natted ports/vms from internal
networks using their floating ips because stateless nat is not able to
differentiate natted/non-natted traffics (it always rewrites natted
ports/vms egress traffics). A follow-up change will define an hybrid nat
driver to use stateless nat for north/south traffic and stateful nat for
east/west traffic.

Related-Bug: #1334926
Partially-Implements: blueprint stateless-floatingips
Change-Id: Id2e8c084381c8552e7f8641724ca083aaa23cb01

commit_message:
Update post_test_hook to use run-tox.sh

Proposed modifications to project-config's run-tox.sh script are
intended to allow reuse by non-unit test jobs.  This change updates
neutron's post_test_hook.sh script to use run-tox.sh to reuse the
testr artifact processing that it defines.

Change-Id: I8fff14c02c35e34efef4bdc523f7fea60391cfa1
Depends-On: Ia69f0bef031b33265d508e6a47cc8fb294cb4830

commit_message:
Fix vlan segementation id out of range of config_file bug

When creating vlan network, vlan id is not in vlan range of config
file, neutron server will create success.

Checking vlan segementation id with neutron config file,
then raise an exception.

Change-Id: Ib9d9faa9b010e75d2be0ceca41704c6b41fe72eb
Closes-Bug: #1449526
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/70/178170/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _check_config_vlan_range(self, segment): for (physical_network, vlan_ranges) in self.network_vlan_ranges.items(): vlan_ids = set() for vlan_min, vlan_max in vlan_ranges: vlan_ids |= set(xrange(vlan_min, vlan_max + 1)) if segment not in vlan_ids: return False return True if not self._check_config_vlan_range(segmentation_id): msg = (_("segmentation_id out of range in config file")) raise exc.InvalidInput(error_message=msg)

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for v2.1 cells

This patch removes db layer hard-code permission checks for v2.1 cells,
also add back-compatible checks for v2 cells

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part
DocImpact
Change-Id: Icdfd065c1fbcc87f71f82a21a577cf6ad97da716

subject: Escape the description param from heat template
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-09 17:16:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/8c756ce80eb70878cbfd9444622ffa54dd27f7bf', 'message': 'Escape the description param from heat template

The heat template allows user to define custom parameters,
the fields are then converted to input fields. The description
param maps to the help_text attribute of the field.

Since the value comes from the user, the value must be escaped
before rendering.

Change-Id: I79d540a8363b2507c4bccdc0cc38e283962919d2
Closes-bug: #1453074

The heat template allows user to define custom parameters,
the fields are then converted to input fields. The description
param maps to the help_text attribute of the field.

commit_message:
Escape the description param from heat template

The heat template allows user to define custom parameters,
the fields are then converted to input fields. The description
param maps to the help_text attribute of the field.

Since the value comes from the user, the value must be escaped
before rendering.

Co-Authored-By: Lin Hua Cheng <os.lcheng@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I79d540a8363b2507c4bccdc0cc38e283962919d2
Closes-bug: #1453074
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/20/189820/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from django.utils import html 'help_text': html.escape(param.get('Description', '')),

subject: Enable udev for lvm in cinder-volume container
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-08 10:30:40.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/vars/config_vars/container_config_cinder_volume.yml', 'rpc_deployment/playbooks/openstack/cinder-volume.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/common/templates/lvm.conf'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/7e48fa53c534d671f0899b9b220471a615bd83de', 'message': "Enable udev for lvm in cinder-volume container

The current configuration of LVM for cinder-volume has udev_sync=0.
This means that udev is not creating the devices that appear in /dev.
The device files created reference specific device numbers, and these
persist between reboots. When the host is rebooted there is no
guarantee that device numbers allocated to the logical volumes will
match those defined in the device files. This can be observed by
comparing the output of 'dmsetup info' and 'ls -l /dev/mapper'.

LVM's use of udev was disabled in an attempt to protect the host from
the potential that uevents generated would be processed by all
containers on the host. In practise this should not be an issue because
there are not other containers running on a cinder host.

This commit adjusts the lvm.conf file created so that udev is used. It
also adds a mount entry to create a devtmpfs on /dev. Finally
'udevadm trigger' is run to add the devices under /dev/mapper.

(cherry picked from commit 389b0f0dd886388fefae0cece2844c35da28e405)

Closes-Bug: #1436999
Change-Id: I9ab35cf4438a369563f8c08870c1acfd0cc394b0
"}]
commit_message:
Enable udev for lvm in cinder-volume container

The current configuration of LVM for cinder-volume has udev_sync=0.
This means that udev is not creating the devices that appear in /dev.
The device files created reference specific device numbers, and these
persist between reboots. When the host is rebooted there is no
guarantee that device numbers allocated to the logical volumes will
match those defined in the device files. This can be observed by
comparing the output of 'dmsetup info' and 'ls -l /dev/mapper'.

LVM's use of udev was disabled in an attempt to protect the host from
the potential that uevents generated would be processed by all
containers on the host. In practise this should not be an issue because
there are not other containers running on a cinder host.

This commit adjusts the lvm.conf file created so that udev is used. It
also adds a mount entry to create a devtmpfs on /dev. Finally
'udevadm trigger' is run to add the devices under /dev/mapper.

(cherry picked from commit 389b0f0dd886388fefae0cece2844c35da28e405)

Closes-Bug: #1436999
Change-Id: I9ab35cf4438a369563f8c08870c1acfd0cc394b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/59/189259/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: {% if is_metal != true %} {% set use_udev = 0 %} {% else %}

commit_message:
Fix $this usage in horizon.tables.js

In horizon.tables.js there are a couple of places where
$(this) is called multiple times in the same function. This
isn't optimal and is corrected by this patch.

Change-Id: I7c644c3dbf96c2958ec351024d7f37a30448c44e
Closes-Bug: 1463501

commit_message:
Port exception_to_str() to Python 3

On Python 3, exception messages are unicode strings. There is no need to
decode them.

Skip the test on the "ignore" error handler on Python 3, it's specific
to Python 2.

Change-Id: Ieec9e1e1f7a0fc901271fd74eca357fe1cf6a975

added_lines: if six.PY2: error = encodeutils.safe_encode(error, errors='ignore') return error

commit_message:
Escape the description param from heat template

The heat template allows user to define custom parameters,
the fields are then converted to input fields. The description
param maps to the help_text attribute of the field.

Since the value comes from the user, the value must be escaped
before rendering.

Change-Id: I79d540a8363b2507c4bccdc0cc38e283962919d2
Closes-bug: #1453074
(cherry picked from commit ecbf4d2bb878b6b6037ee54f195182e46297e85d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/85/189985/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from django.utils import html 'help_text': html.escape(param.get('Description', '')),

commit_message:
import error by l3_odl

tox -e py27 fails as follows.
This is because importing common_db_mixin from db_base_plugin_v2 was removed,
by the change set of ece8cc2e9aae1610a325d0c206e38da3da9a0a1a,
by the change id of I1eac61c258541bca80e14be4b7c75519a014ffae

commit_message:
Include links to developer workflow documentation

Newcomers aren't always sure how to get started with our tools or
workflow. Lucky for them, we have documented these things. Unlucky for
them, they have no idea the docs exist.

Give them some links.

Change-Id: I6fce6fbccb8a9fe16b48845790b4cac05317ebac

commit_message:
Add functional tests for volume set and unset

Add functional tests for volume set and unset for metadata and
resource values.

Change-Id: Ief07fc5c480608bb900d55df935b89c503609c80
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/29/188129/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
OTHER_NAME = uuid.uuid4().hex # Rename test raw_output = cls.openstack( 'volume set --name ' + cls.OTHER_NAME + ' ' + cls.NAME) cls.assertOutput('', raw_output) # Delete test raw_output = cls.openstack('volume delete ' + cls.OTHER_NAME) def test_volume_properties(self): raw_output = self.openstack( 'volume set --property a=b --property c=d ' + self.NAME) self.assertEqual("", raw_output) opts = self.get_show_opts(["properties"]) raw_output = self.openstack('volume show ' + self.NAME + opts) self.assertEqual("a='b', c='d'
", raw_output) raw_output = self.openstack('volume unset --property a ' + self.NAME) self.assertEqual("", raw_output) raw_output = self.openstack('volume show ' + self.NAME + opts) self.assertEqual("c='d'
", raw_output) def test_volume_set(self): raw_output = self.openstack( 'volume set --description RAMAC ' + self.NAME) opts = self.get_show_opts(["display_description", "display_name"]) raw_output = self.openstack('volume show ' + self.NAME + opts) self.assertEqual("RAMAC
" + self.NAME + "
", raw_output)

commit_message:
Make 'echo' work in the 'venv' environment

Our documentation uses the example of:
    tox -evenv -- echo 'done'

Which fails with the error:
    WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
      cmd: /usr/bin/echo
      env: /home/john/openstack/ironic/.tox/venv
    Maybe forgot to specify a dependency?

This fixes that issue.

Change-Id: I9beeea1887ed6abfe3e319598cd687b6c6229bac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/77/189477/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: whitelist_externals = echo

commit_message:
Make 'echo' work in the 'venv' environment

Our documentation uses the example of:
    tox -evenv -- echo 'done'

Which fails with the error:
    WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
      cmd: /usr/bin/echo
      env: /home/john/openstack/ironic/.tox/venv
    Maybe forgot to specify a dependency?

This fixes that issue.

Change-Id: Iec7d24f72f1c8eec90a5c4a5d6ff099f698fd7b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/82/189482/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: whitelist_externals = echo

Change auth_url to identity_uri

Auth_url is deprecated in the document, replace it with
identity_uri, also add auth_rui configuration.

commit_message:
Encapsulate Service Providers in AccessInfo

This patch adds the support for the AccessInfo object to return the
list of Service Providers encapsulated in a class that provides methods
to access URL attributes from each service provider present in the list.

Change-Id: I7f5ed8c5cb64482eb2d8cf98a8eba33f483eb88d
Closes-Bug: 1459702

added_lines: TEST_SERVICE_PROVIDERS = [ { "auth_url": "https://sp1.com/v3/OS-FEDERATION/" "identity_providers/acme/protocols/saml2/auth", "id": "sp1", "sp_url": "https://sp1.com/Shibboleth.sso/SAML2/ECP" }, { "auth_url": "https://sp2.com/v3/OS-FEDERATION/" "identity_providers/acme/protocols/saml2/auth", "id": "sp2", "sp_url": "https://sp2.com/Shibboleth.sso/SAML2/ECP" } ] "catalog": self.TEST_SERVICE_CATALOG, "service_providers": self.TEST_SERVICE_PROVIDERS def test_service_providers_urls(self): self.stub_auth(json=self.TEST_RESPONSE_DICT) a = v3.Password(self.TEST_URL, username=self.TEST_USER, password=self.TEST_PASS) s = session.Session() auth_ref = a.get_auth_ref(s) service_providers = auth_ref.service_providers self.assertEqual('https://sp1.com/v3/OS-FEDERATION/' 'identity_providers/acme/protocols/saml2/auth', service_providers.get_auth_url('sp1')) self.assertEqual('https://sp1.com/Shibboleth.sso/SAML2/ECP', service_providers.get_sp_url('sp1')) self.assertEqual('https://sp2.com/v3/OS-FEDERATION/' 'identity_providers/acme/protocols/saml2/auth', service_providers.get_auth_url('sp2')) self.assertEqual('https://sp2.com/Shibboleth.sso/SAML2/ECP', service_providers.get_sp_url('sp2'))
